Column Comment.0: RESERVES ENTITY IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for a reserves entity. A reservesentity may be comprised of a single business object (such as a well) or a group ofbusiness objects (such as all the completions producing from a pool).
Column Comment.1: RESERVE CLASS IDENTIFIER: The reserve classed for identifying the confidencelevel and producing status of the reserve volumes.
Column Comment.2: PROPERTY SEQUENCE NUMBER: a unique number added to allow propertiess tobe versioned over time.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.5: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.6: HEAT CONTENT: Gross energy released on combustion.
Column Comment.7: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.8: LOSS OR SHRINKAGE FACTOR: Anticipated loss in processing. Expressed as apercent or a fraction.
Column Comment.9: OIL DENISTY: The density of the oil relative to the specific gravity of water. May alsobe kg per cubic meter.
Column Comment.10: OIL DENSITY OUOM: Oil density original unit of measure.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should becreated.
Column Comment.12: PRODUCT TYPE: The product that these properties describe
Column Comment.13: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.14: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.15: SULPHUR CONTENT: A measure of the amount of sulphur a product contains. Maybe expressed as a percent or as a mass per volume.
Column Comment.16: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE: Original unit of measure for a value.
Column Comment.17: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.18: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.19: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.20: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.21: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.22: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.23: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
